description: Returns a description of a processing job.

parameters.name: ProcessingJobName
parameters.description: The name of the processing job. The name must be unique within an Amazon Web Services Region in the Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: ProcessingInputs
nested_items.description: The inputs for a processing job.

nested_items.name: InputName
nested_items.description: The name for the processing job input.

nested_items.name: AppManaged
nested_items.description: When True, input operations such as data download are managed natively by the processing job application. When False (default), input operations are managed by Amazon SageMaker.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: The URI of the Amazon S3 prefix Amazon SageMaker downloads data required to run a processing job.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: The local path in your container where you want Amazon SageMaker to write input data to. LocalPath is an absolute path to the input data and must begin with /opt/ml/processing/. LocalPath is a required parameter when AppManaged is False (default).

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: Whether you use an S3Prefix or a ManifestFile for the data type. If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. Amazon SageMaker uses all objects with the specified key name prefix for the processing job. If you choose ManifestFile, S3Uri identifies an object that is a manifest file containing a list of object keys that you want Amazon SageMaker to use for the processing job.

nested_items.name: S3InputMode
nested_items.description: Whether to use File or Pipe input mode. In File mode, Amazon SageMaker copies the data from the input source onto the local ML storage volume before starting your processing container. This is the most commonly used input mode. In Pipe mode, Amazon SageMaker streams input data from the source directly to your processing container into named pipes without using the ML storage volume.

nested_items.name: S3DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: Whether to distribute the data from Amazon S3 to all processing instances with FullyReplicated, or whether the data from Amazon S3 is shared by Amazon S3 key, downloading one shard of data to each processing instance.

nested_items.name: S3CompressionType
nested_items.description: Whether to GZIP-decompress the data in Amazon S3 as it is streamed into the processing container. Gzip can only be used when Pipe mode is specified as the S3InputMode. In Pipe mode, Amazon SageMaker streams input data from the source directly to your container without using the EBS volume.

nested_items.name: DatasetDefinition
nested_items.description: Configuration for a Dataset Definition input.

nested_items.name: AthenaDatasetDefinition
nested_items.description: Configuration for Athena Dataset Definition input.

nested_items.name: Catalog
nested_items.description: The name of the data catalog used in Athena query execution.

nested_items.name: Database
nested_items.description: The name of the database used in the Athena query execution.

nested_items.name: QueryString
nested_items.description: The SQL query statements, to be executed.

nested_items.name: WorkGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the workgroup in which the Athena query is being started.

nested_items.name: OutputS3Uri
nested_items.description: The location in Amazon S3 where Athena query results are stored.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data generated from an Athena query execution.

nested_items.name: OutputFormat
nested_items.description: The data storage format for Athena query results.

nested_items.name: OutputCompression
nested_items.description: The compression used for Athena query results.

nested_items.name: RedshiftDatasetDefinition
nested_items.description: Configuration for Redshift Dataset Definition input.

nested_items.name: ClusterId
nested_items.description: The Redshift cluster Identifier.

nested_items.name: Database
nested_items.description: The name of the Redshift database used in Redshift query execution.

nested_items.name: DbUser
nested_items.description: The database user name used in Redshift query execution.

nested_items.name: QueryString
nested_items.description: The SQL query statements to be executed.

nested_items.name: ClusterRoleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role attached to your Redshift cluster that Amazon SageMaker uses to generate datasets.

nested_items.name: OutputS3Uri
nested_items.description: The location in Amazon S3 where the Redshift query results are stored.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data from a Redshift execution.

nested_items.name: OutputFormat
nested_items.description: The data storage format for Redshift query results.

nested_items.name: OutputCompression
nested_items.description: The compression used for Redshift query results.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: The local path where you want Amazon SageMaker to download the Dataset Definition inputs to run a processing job. LocalPath is an absolute path to the input data. This is a required parameter when AppManaged is False (default).

nested_items.name: DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: Whether the generated dataset is FullyReplicated or ShardedByS3Key (default).

nested_items.name: InputMode
nested_items.description: Whether to use File or Pipe input mode. In File (default) mode, Amazon SageMaker copies the data from the input source onto the local Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes before starting your training algorithm. This is the most commonly used input mode. In Pipe mode, Amazon SageMaker streams input data from the source directly to your algorithm without using the EBS volume.

nested_items.name: ProcessingOutputConfig
nested_items.description: Output configuration for the processing job.

nested_items.name: Outputs
nested_items.description: An array of outputs configuring the data to upload from the processing container.

nested_items.name: OutputName
nested_items.description: The name for the processing job output.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: A URI that identifies the Amazon S3 bucket where you want Amazon SageMaker to save the results of a processing job.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: The local path of a directory where you want Amazon SageMaker to upload its contents to Amazon S3. LocalPath is an absolute path to a directory containing output files. This directory will be created by the platform and exist when your container's entrypoint is invoked.

nested_items.name: S3UploadMode
nested_items.description: Whether to upload the results of the processing job continuously or after the job completes.

nested_items.name: FeatureStoreOutput
nested_items.description: Configuration for processing job outputs in Amazon SageMaker Feature Store. This processing output type is only supported when AppManaged is specified.

nested_items.name: FeatureGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon SageMaker FeatureGroup to use as the destination for processing job output. Note that your processing script is responsible for putting records into your Feature Store.

nested_items.name: AppManaged
nested_items.description: When True, output operations such as data upload are managed natively by the processing job application. When False (default), output operations are managed by Amazon SageMaker.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the processing job output. KmsKeyId can be an ID of a KMS key, ARN of a KMS key, or alias of a KMS key. The KmsKeyId is applied to all outputs.

nested_items.name: ProcessingJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the processing job. The name must be unique within an Amazon Web Services Region in the Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: ProcessingResources
nested_items.description: Identifies the resources, ML compute instances, and ML storage volumes to deploy for a processing job. In distributed training, you specify more than one instance.

nested_items.name: ClusterConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the resources in a cluster used to run the processing job.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use in the processing job. For distributed processing jobs, specify a value greater than 1. The default value is 1.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type for the processing job.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the ML storage volume in gigabytes that you want to provision. You must specify sufficient ML storage for your scenario.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the processing job.

nested_items.name: StoppingCondition
nested_items.description: The time limit for how long the processing job is allowed to run.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum runtime in seconds.

nested_items.name: AppSpecification
nested_items.description: Configures the processing job to run a specified container image.

nested_items.name: ImageUri
nested_items.description: The container image to be run by the processing job.

nested_items.name: ContainerEntrypoint
nested_items.description: The entrypoint for a container used to run a processing job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ContainerArguments
nested_items.description: The arguments for a container used to run a processing job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables set in the Docker container.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NetworkConfig
nested_items.description: Networking options for a processing job.

nested_items.name: EnableInterContainerTrafficEncryption
nested_items.description: Whether to encrypt all communications between distributed processing jobs. Choose True to encrypt communications. Encryption provides greater security for distributed processing jobs, but the processing might take longer.

nested_items.name: EnableNetworkIsolation
nested_items.description: Whether to allow inbound and outbound network calls to and from the containers used for the processing job.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) that your SageMaker jobs, hosted models, and compute resources have access to. You can control access to and from your resources by configuring a VPC. For more information, see Give SageMaker Access to Resources in your Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that Amazon SageMaker can assume to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: ExperimentConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration information used to create an experiment.

nested_items.name: ExperimentName
nested_items.description: The name of an existing experiment to associate with the trial component.

nested_items.name: TrialName
nested_items.description: The name of an existing trial to associate the trial component with. If not specified, a new trial is created.

nested_items.name: TrialComponentDisplayName
nested_items.description: The display name for the trial component. If this key isn't specified, the display name is the trial component name.

nested_items.name: RunName
nested_items.description: The name of the experiment run to associate with the trial component.

nested_items.name: ProcessingJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the processing job.

nested_items.name: ProcessingJobStatus
nested_items.description: Provides the status of a processing job.

nested_items.name: ExitMessage
nested_items.description: An optional string, up to one KB in size, that contains metadata from the processing container when the processing job exits.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: A string, up to one KB in size, that contains the reason a processing job failed, if it failed.

nested_items.name: ProcessingEndTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the processing job completed.

nested_items.name: ProcessingStartTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the processing job started.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the processing job was last modified.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the processing job was created.

nested_items.name: MonitoringScheduleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a monitoring schedule for an endpoint associated with this processing job.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of an AutoML job associated with this processing job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a training job associated with this processing job.
